message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.MM, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of achieving perfect secrecy in a multi-access communication scenario, where multiple users communicate with an intended receiver in the presence of an eavesdropper. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of Gaussian codebooks and power allocation to maximize the achievable sum-rate suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of multimedia (cs.MM), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
